title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
GM's net profit declined 40% in the second quarter, hurt by a loss in China and supply-chain troubles that left the company with tens of thousands of unfinished vehicles it couldn't sell during the period.

---

Credit Suisse is set to announce the departure of CEO Gottstein, according to people familiar with the bank, part of an effort to turn around the lender's fortunes.

---

Google parent Alphabet reported the slowest quarterly sales growth in two years, as macroeconomic pressures weigh on the market for digital ads.

---

Microsoft posted its slowest earnings growth in two years, hurt by a deceleration in its cloud business, declining videogame sales and the effects of the strong dollar.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes declined, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials losing 1.2%, 1.9% and 0.7%, respectively.

---

GE's revenue rose in the latest quarter on a rebound in its jet-engine business, but the company lowered its forecast for 2022 free cash flow.

---

Activist investor Elliott Management has a stake in PayPal, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

Shopify is laying off roughly 1,000 workers, or 10% of the e-commerce firm's global workforce, according to an internal memo.

---

Twitter scheduled a shareholder vote on Musk's takeover proposal, weeks after he stated his intention to walk away from the deal.
